I have played DBD for just over 1000 hours, and it's ok once and a great while you get a killer that knows how to not tunnel or camp the hooks but still win the game, but very rarely! I don't care if I die I just want a fun game, and so I keep playing for that once a great while fun game! They are constantly adding new content to the game. Try playing killer, and survivor both to get a better feel of the game. I am a Survivor mainly. Killer has to be played in first person which I don't care for. IMPORTANT: You can turn off chat so people can't be rude to you just a heads up! Have Fun! 5/5 Stars!!

I played this game 1,5 K hours and honestly, I thought I will fanboy it till the end of my life. Every bad decision, every bug, everything I would hate in a "normal" game, I supported this sack of crap. But enough is enough. Since the Devs introduced "Skill based" Matchmaking (yes, I put that in quotation marks for a reason, we will come to that later), this game went downhill.

First of all: DbD was always known for it's wide variety of bugs and it's, at best, suboptimal balancing. Like many other unsymmetric competetive games (see examples like "Last Year: The Nightmare" or "Prop Night"), this game clearly favored survivors over the Killer, which was in some way understandable, because the biggest part of the playerbase where some trolley people trying to bully the "Big Bad Guy". Okay, i coped with it and became somewhat of a decent Killer and a passionate survivor for the gameplay was fun.

Second, the game was constantly changing things that either didn't need any changes or needed different changes, based on what the majority of the community was asking for. A lot of things have been messed up by the devs, without me saying much against it, because I thought "It is their game, they will know what is best" and "I don't have any choice in that anyway, I'll adapt to it".

However, the game got worse and worse without me realizing it, because of these thoughts. And now, at the culprit of all, after so many years I accompanied this game, it finally reached the point that even scared me away. And why? The answer is clear: "Skill Based" Matchmaking.

An obscure way of matching players, that the Devs themselve can't even really explain and / or show ingame, solely based on "We have our eyes on it, trust us, it works...somehow...". In the begining, everything is fine, seemingly. But as soon as you reach a (kind of) mediocre "skill", you are matched with people way over your level that completly destroy you. May it be as survivor or as killer. Sure, there are people that can do it. But these people either play the game 24/7 or are part of the 10% elite that are good enough to beat literally ANY opponent, no matter what. And that is, unfortunatly, hardly enjoyable at all for everyone else.

If you enjoy putting your efford into thousends of hours into one single game or belong to this 10% group that is naturally talented of killing / surviving at any circumstances, I do in fact recommend this game, as of it's current state. If your are looking for a relaxing, casual or semi-casual experience to just have some fun without beeing forced into a complete sweat-off, you are in the wrong place buddy.

I loved this game for years, but the time has come to move on, I think. Farewell, Dead by Daylight, maybe I will see you again in your former glory...But at your current state, I just can't enjoy you any more.

Considering that I was just about ready to give up on this game a couple of months back, I'm quite surprised I can actually say that Dead by Daylight is fun to play again. As nice as the few tweaks and reworks in the past few patches may have been, what truly made DbD enjoyable once more was the huge perk overhaul. It was so tiring seeing  the same 8 perks on both sides every game.
With the most oppressive perks from both sides tuned down to be more balanced and some underused and situational perks buffed to be more worth bringing, there is so much more variety on both survivor and killer side. Basekit BT is great as prevention against the killer just focusing on one person, while the killer buffs make playing M1 killers much more manageable. 
Overall, this update made both survivor and killer gameplay much more enjoyable and the game actually feels fresh.

Overall score: 3.0/4.0
Hours played to date: 459 hours
I was obsessed with this game during the height of the pandemic when I wasn't working. I'd play it 5+ hours everyday and have been called a DBD encyclopedia by my friends. There are many options to personalize the gameplay style as well as your character style. There have been regular updates as the game's popularity has grown. The DLC can be pricey, but you can by original characters and many skins with shards that are gained from sinking hours into the game. The queue times are occasionally long, but you can avoid those long waits by playing Survivor during the day and Killer at night. I am obsessed with this game and highly recommend.

SCORE BREAKDOWN:

BUGS: 3/4
4-No bugs
*3-Minimal bugs
2-Many bugs, annoying to play
1-Game-breaking bugs

CONTENT VARIABILITY: 3/4
4-Constantly entertained
*3-Keeps attention with some slower portions
2-Lots of grinding
1-Boring and repetitive

GRAPHICS: 3/4
4-Outstanding
*3-Beautiful
2-Fair
1-Cringey

MUSIC: 2/4
4-Outstanding
3-Good
*2-Fair or lacking
1-Terrible or non-existent

PRICE: 3/4
4-Highly affordable
*3-Fair when on sale
2-Expensive or has pricey DLC
1-Unreasonably high

REPLAYABILITY: 4/4
*4-Could play a million times
3-Great to play again, but missing the spark of the first time
2-Doesn‚Äôt live up to the first playthrough
1-You‚Äôve seen it all after the first playthrough

SETTINGS OPTIONS: 3/4
4-Intuitive, clear, easy to adjust, and has many accessibility options
*3-Clear settings but could be improved
2-Lacking settings options or confusing, lacking accessibility options
1-Very few settings options, no accessibility options

SKILL LEVEL: 3/4
4-Adjustable and appropriate
*3-Appropriate level for game
2-Could use more adjustment settings
1-Too difficult or easy

STORYLINE: 2/4
4-Will make you laugh, cry, and feel all the emotions
3-You‚Äôll become invested in the characters
*2-Limited storyline
1-No storyline or does not make sense

LENGTH: 4/4
*4-Perfect length and can take things slower or faster as you‚Äôd like
3-Great length, but wish it was a little longer or shorter
2-Seems slightly rushed or cut short
1-Drags on or is way too short

ADDITIONAL NOTES
Cheater reports not taken seriously: -1
Great to play with friends: +1

SCORE: 30/10=3.0/4.0
